definition: to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Ben was so indignant that be seized the man by the collar.
sentences.chinese: 本气极了，揪住了那个人的衣领。

sentences.english: I jump from the cross-beams and seize the clover and timothy.
sentences.chinese: 我从横木上跳下来，揪住了苜蓿和猫尾草。

sentences.english: Grabs a fistful of the infidels hair.
sentences.chinese: 一把揪住那异教徒的头发。

sentences.english: Like one who seizes a dog by the ears is a passer-by who meddles in a quarrel not his own.
sentences.chinese: 过路被事激动，管理不干己的争竞，好象人揪住狗耳。

sentences.english: Several policemen tackled the enemy spy and got him down.
sentences.chinese: 几个警察揪住了敌特，把他摔倒在地。

sentences.english: Her fingers clutched the clothes, and gathered them over her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指紧揪住衣服，又把衣服合拢来遮住眼睛。

sentences.english: 17Then they all turned on Sosthenes the synagogue ruler and beat him in front of the court.
sentences.chinese: 众人便揪住管会堂的所提尼，在堂前打他。

definition: to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
with a lightning move of the hand
to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
